key_insight: A network-aware self-supervised learning method produces robust, label-efficient representations of neuronal activity dynamics, enabling high-content phenotypic screening that reliably identifies genetic modifiers across diverse neural interventions.
problem_solved: Scales and automates detection of subtle, network-level activity phenotypes without extensive labeled data, bridging the gap between genetic perturbations and dynamic neuronal responses across experimental conditions.
method: Incorporate network structure (connectivity/topology) into self-supervised representation learning so activity patterns are contextualized by circuit relationships.
Design temporal and structural pretext tasks that capture dynamic phenotypes from time-series neural recordings, producing compact embeddings of activity dynamics.
Use the learned embeddings in a high-content screening pipeline to compare perturbations and prioritize candidate genetic modifiers across multiple intervention types.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners a transferable, label-efficient framework for learning representations of time-varying, graph-structured biological data, enabling scalable phenotypic screens and more interpretable links between perturbations and dynamic responses.
visual_elements: Pipeline schematic: raw neural recordings + network graph → network-aware self-supervised encoder → phenotypic embeddings → perturbation comparison/ hit discovery
Dimensionality reduction plot (e.g., UMAP) of embeddings showing clusters corresponding to distinct activity phenotypes and selected genetic modifiers
Heatmaps or raster plots comparing temporal dynamics before/after perturbations, annotated with embedding-based similarity scores
Icon-based workflow showing label efficiency and generalization across different neural interventions (e.g., pharmacology, optogenetics, genetic perturbation)
paper_title: Network-aware self-supervised learning enables high-content phenotypic screening for genetic modifiers of neuronal activity dynamics
paper_authors: Parker Grosjean, Kaivalya Shevade, Cuong Nguyen, Sarah Ancheta, Karl Mader
